Some people live their entire lives stifled by fear. They turn down opportunities and reject incredible possibilities due to the fear of failure. Don’t fall into that trap. If you are unable to overcome your fears, they will overcome you.

Wednesday's thought:  Balance...the only way to enjoy the fruit of our work efforts is to enjoy life.  Do the best we can while on the job, but when the workday ends it stops right there.  The quality of our life depends on what life provides for us, so we need to put the same amount of effort in into our lives that we do with work. It's about maintaining our work-life balance.  Cheers to being in balance and enjoying what life brings us!

•	Teaching Trainees Culinary Skills, Work etiquette and Stress Management•	Working hands on and Managing Kitchen during service •	Menu Design and Creating Specials•	Food ordering and inventory•	Production for Caterings•	Specials Promotions and Demonstrations•	Maintaining Health code compliance•	Sustaining Organization and Cleanliness of the Kitchen

Responsible for running, supervising, working in the kitchen and dining room/patio. Supplied all food to patients and staff, ranging from 150-250 people. Three meals as day served buffet style to include multiple starches, vegetable and proteins, ranging selection from hearty comfort foods to very healthy/special needs selection. Vast array of snack selections ever evolving and changing which were available at all times. Constant supervision of the dining room and patio, assuring cleanliness and that all products were stocked. Acquired an in depth working knowledge of special needs diets, used on a daily basis as needed. Special need diets to include Gluten Free, Vegetarian, Vegan, Soft, Bland, Diabetic, Low Sodium and Kosher. Worked closely with eating disorder patients and provided weekly cooking demonstrations on their behalf. Creating multiple four week rotating menus to included breakfast lunch and dinner. All menus in compliance with strict institutional/hospital and state standards. Redesigned and orchestrated the reconstruction of the kitchen. Attending and participating in all Board of directors meeting and responsibilities. To include forecasting and executing necessary goals.
Cooking Meals for the members/staff, Organizing and executing  meals for holidays  and special events, teaching culinary skills

Miciah Beard is a talented, innovative chef. I've eaten in several restaurants under his direction and have never had a negative experience. In addition, he has brought a team to cook in my home. Their workmanship and creativity was a  sight to behold. Whether he is being considered for a professional kitchen or a special home prepared meal you cannot go wrong using Miciah.

summary: Currently seeking new opportunities, willing to relocate and interested in working abroad internationally. I am an Experienced Executive Chef, specializing in brand development and strategic planning with an in-depth knowledge of the food and beverage industry. I have over 27 years of hands on experience and an advanced understanding of restaurant, catering and banquet operations at all levels. Furthermore,  a demonstrated proficiency in staffing, training, development, menu design, budgeting, labor and food cost management.
